intro: Villarsia cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian star vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
